Ingredients.11: 1 (16 ounce) package thin rice noodles (such as Thai Kitchen®)

Ingredients.12: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, or as needed

Ingredients.13: 2 (14 ounce) packages firm tofu, drained and cut into 1/4-inch slices

Ingredients.20: 0.25 cup Thai basil leaves, torn into bite-size pieces

Directions.1: Place vegetable stock, onion, soy sauce, garlic, cinnamon sticks, ground ginger, star anise, and bay leaves in a large pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until flavors combine, 30 to 45 minutes. Remove solids with a slotted spoon and keep broth hot.

Directions.2: Place noodles in a large bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside until noodles are softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and rinse thoroughly. Divide noodles among 6 serving bowls.

Directions.3: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add tofu in a single layer and fry, in batches, until golden brown, about 6 minutes per side.

Directions.4: Simmer fried tofu and mushrooms in broth until heated through, about 5 minutes. Transfer to serving bowls. Top with scallions and cilantro. Ladle in hot broth.

Directions.5: Serve lime wedges, jalapeno peppers, bean sprouts, and basil alongside for garnishing each bowl.
